definition[0]: having a meaning that is easy to understand and makes sense
example[0]: Without more data we cannot make a meaningful comparison of the two systems.
example[1]: Teaching history to five-year-olds in a meaningful way can be very difficult.
example[2]: Rules must be put in a context that is meaningful to the children.
example[3]: They want a chance to do meaningful work.
example[4]: I want a mature and meaningful relationship.
